name: Nollywood Film City
address: Film Village, Kuje Area Council, FCT Abuja, Nigeria
description: Nigeria's premier film production hub and heart of Nollywood, the world's second-largest film industry. Features state-of-the-art studios, equipment rental, and post-production facilities producing over 2,500 films annually.
alt: Nollywood Film City production studios and facilities

name: Afrobeats Music Hub Lagos
description: Epicenter of Nigeria's global Afrobeats scene on Victoria Island. Houses major record labels, studios, and venues where stars like Burna Boy, Wizkid, and Davido create music that influences global culture.
alt: Lagos music studios and Afrobeats cultural district

visitor_info.tour_availability: Concert venues and some studios offer tours

name: Lagos Island Central Business District
description: Commercial heart of West Africa's largest city with over 15 million people. Features towering skyscrapers, major financial institutions, and the famous Balogun Market in one of the world's fastest-growing megacities.
alt: Lagos Island business district skyline and urban landscape

name: Aso Rock Presidential Complex
description: Nigeria's seat of power built around the iconic 400-meter high Aso Rock monolith. Houses the Presidential Villa, National Assembly, and Supreme Court around this 500-million-year-old rock formation.
alt: Aso Rock monolith and Presidential Complex in Abuja

visitor_info.tour_availability: Official government tours by special arrangement

name: Niger Delta Oil Museum
address: Oloibiri, Ogbia Local Government Area, Bayelsa State, Nigeria
description: Located at Oloibiri where commercial oil was first discovered in Nigeria (1956). Commemorates the petroleum industry that transformed the nation's economy, with Nigeria now producing over 2 million barrels daily.
alt: Niger Delta Oil Museum and historical oil drilling equipment

name: Yankari National Park
address: Yankari National Park, Alkaleri, Bauchi State, Nigeria
description: Nigeria's premier wildlife sanctuary spanning 2,244 square kilometers. Home to West Africa's largest elephant population, lions, leopards, hippos, and the famous Wikki Warm Springs heated to 31Â°C year-round.
alt: Yankari National Park elephants and savanna landscape

visitor_info.tour_availability: Game drives and guided nature walks

name: Benin City National Museum
address: Ring Road, Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria
description: Houses one of the world's finest African art collections, including the famous Benin Bronzes - intricate brass sculptures from the historic Kingdom of Benin (13th-19th centuries) representing pinnacle achievements in African metallurgy.
alt: Ancient Benin Bronzes displayed in museum setting

name: Jollof Rice Cultural Center
address: National Theatre Complex, Iganmu, Lagos, Nigeria
description: Cultural center dedicated to Nigeria's beloved Jollof rice and culinary heritage. Offers cooking classes, cultural exhibitions, and hosts the annual 'Jollof Festival' celebrating West African cuisine with tastings and demonstrations.
alt: Traditional Nigerian Jollof rice preparation and cultural cooking demonstration

visitor_info.best_time_to_visit: Year-round, special events during cultural festivals
